result.execSummary:
The defendant Dontreal D Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

9:17 AM Defendant Dontreal D Wright in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Dontreal D Wright.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Deft. to plea to Ct. 1, State stipulates to credit for time served, defendant will be extradite to South Carolina.

PLEA: Ct. 1: NC
BTC: Ct. 1: GUILTY
Parties are willing to waive PSI and are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

BTC: Ct. 1: 68 days RCJ, 68 days CFTS.
Repay costs and surcharges forthwith, to be converted to a civil judgment.
DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. WHILE IN WISCONSIN ONLY: This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:02 PM Defendant Dontreal D Wright appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Dontreal D Wright.  Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
